title: 107_hr2310
content: The "Military Pay Raise Act of 2001" increases monthly basic pay for uniformed services members effective January 1, 2002, based on pay grade and years of service. The "Military Pay Raise Act of 2001" increases monthly basic pay for commissioned officers based on pay grade and years of service. The "Military Pay Raise Act of 2001" increases monthly basic pay for commissioned officers based on pay grade and years of service. The pay percentages for different officer ranks are as follows: O-3 to O-1 receive 8.3%, O-10 to O-4 receive 7.3%, and O-4 receives 9.0%. The "Military Pay Raise Act of 2001" increases monthly basic pay for commissioned officers based on pay grade and years of service. The pay percentages for different officer ranks are as follows: O-3 to O-1 receive 8.3%, O-10 to O-4 receive 7.3%, and O-4 receives 9.0%. The pay percentages for different officer ranks are as follows: O-3 to O-1 receive 8.3%, O-10 to O-4 receive 7.3%, and O-4 receives 9.0%. The Military Pay Raise Act of 2001 increases monthly basic pay for commissioned officers based on pay grade and years of service. The pay percentages for different officer ranks are as follows: O-3 to O-1 receive 8.3%, O-10 to O-4 receive 7.3%, and O-4 receives 9.0%. Commissioned officers with over 4 years of active duty service as an enlisted member or warrant officer receive pay increases based on their pay grade. The percentages range from 7.3% to 8.3% depending on the years of service and pay grade. Commissioned officers with over 4 years of active duty service receive pay increases ranging from 7.3% to 8.3% based on their pay grade and years of service. WARRANT OFFICERS receive pay increases ranging from 7.5% to 8.5% based on their pay grade and years of service. Warrant officers receive pay increases ranging from 7.5% to 8.5% based on their pay grade and years of service, with specific percentages for different age brackets. Warrant officers receive pay increases ranging from 7.5% to 8.5% based on their pay grade and years of service. Enlisted members receive pay increases ranging from 7.3% to 10.5% based on their pay grade and years of service. Enlisted members receive pay increases ranging from 7.3% to 10.5% based on their pay grade and years of service. The pay percentages for different pay grades are as follows: E-9 - 10.5%, E-8 - 10.0%, E-7 - 9.5%, E-6 - 8.5%, E-5 - 8.5%, E-4 - 7.5%, E-3 - 7.3%, E-2 - 7.3%. Enlisted members receive pay increases ranging from 7.3% to 10.5% based on their pay grade and years of service. The pay percentages for different pay grades are as follows: E-9 - 10.5%, E-8 - 10.0%, E-7 - 9.5%, E-6 - 8.5%, E-5 - 8.5%, E-4 - 7.5%, E-3 - 7.3%, E-2 - 7.3%. Enlisted members receive pay increases ranging from 7.3% to 10.5% based on their pay grade and years of service. The pay percentages for different pay grades are as follows: E-9 - 10.5%, E-8 - 10.0%, E-7 - 9.5%, E-6 - 8.5%, E-5 - 8.5%, E-4 - 7.5%, E-3 - 7.3%, E-2 - 7.3%. The adjustment to monthly basic pay rates for uniformed services members in fiscal year 2002 required by section 1009 of title 37, United States Code, shall not be made.
